goal.en:
LIMITED TO ENGLISH FRESHMEN. 
This course was specifically designed for English 
Freshmen. If you are not a first-year student majoring in 
English, you will not be allowed to enroll. 

Overview: This theory and practice-course based seeks to 
provide students with basic critical thinking skills to assess
social and cultural content in oral form.

outline.en:
ALL COURSE CONTENT WILL BE PROVIDED IN
ENGLISH.
For the oral content, we will pay attention to discussions
related to the themes of (i) interpretative injustice and
(ii) translation.

textbook.en:
Main references: 

* Baker, Mona ＆ Gabriela Saldanha (eds.), 2020, The 
Routledge Encyclopedia of Translation Studies, 3rd. 
Edition, Routledge. 

* Fricker, Miranda, 2007, Epistemic Injustice, Oxford 
University Press. 

* Kirsten Malmkjær ＆ Kevin Windle (eds.), 2011, The 
Oxford Handbook of Translation Studies, Oxford 
University Press. 

Course handouts and references will be ready to be
photocopied the first week of classes.

gradMethod.en:
ATTENDING THE FIRST CLASS IS MANDATORY.

WORK FOR THE COURSE: 
Weekly Attendance: 20％ 
[With more than two absences, 
the student will automatically fail the course. Please, 
bear this in mind.]
Weekly Classroom Exercises: 20％ 
Midterm Presentation: 30％
Final Presentation: 30％

officeHour.en: By appointment on Friday from 1 to 2 pm.
